title: Senior Finance Implementation Manager
content:
Your Mission
As a financial institution moving billions of GBP of customer money in more than 70 countries, Wise must have bulletproof financials. 
Wise is rapidly expanding globally, creating new products to consumers and businesses, and entering new jurisdictions. This is a unique opportunity to  lead complex projects implementing new Wise products and markets into Wise’s finance system  supporting Wise in being financially compliant and ensures our bigger team can make timely, accurate and sustainable business decisions based on a global set of financials.

How you’ll contribute to our Mission

Our Finance Implementation team ensures that anything happening in Wise that has a financial impact  is integrated  into our financial systems and is properly recorded and controlled. This requires working closely with our product and engineering teams and finance stakeholders on understanding how things work in Wise and how they translate into compliant financials 
You’ll be responsible for understanding the whys and hows of the Wise and Finance integration and communicate across all finance stakeholders and financial concepts to engineers
You will figure out a plan and work with a team of product managers, engineers, analysts and operations specialists to integrate all new Wise products, regions and entities into our finance ledger
You will support the team with clear documentation including requirements, detailed project plans, resource allocation, testing, delivery etc.
You will work with our internal finance teams, such as Accounting, Tax, Reporting and Financial Planning & Analysis to ensure clean, accurate and compliant financials in all our entities worldwide in a timely manner


This role will give you the opportunity to

Choose your path to impact – we believe people are most empowered when they can act autonomously. So rather than telling you what to do, you’ll work with your team to create a vision of your own. Of course, you can always gather feedback from smart, curious people across Wise but you’ll have the freedom to make your own calls
Get amazing exposure to the full breadth and depth of our internal product finance systems while working with a group of amazing and dedicated implementation managers, engineers, analysts, and operations. 
Work in a world-class international Finance Team, learn a lot about fintech and finance and drive financial sustainability of Wise, while also building a high-volume, real time financial implementation system
Work with a modern microservices system with key parts written in-house, which allows to move fast and build controls and experiences that are above industry standards and push the boundaries of what is possible
Be part of our mission to make money without borders the new normal


A bit about you

You’re hands on when it comes to product implementation and delivering features and building roadmaps. You’d do everything needed to make the team and the product successful. You get it done
You have experience of managing end-to-end product integration lifecycles from scoping to delivery and post production support for ambitious, impactful customer / non-customer facing products before in data-driven environments
Data-driven – You can pick up the signal from the noise. You are comfortable to dig deep into data, explore and make decisions based on insights
You’re familiar with SQL and can communicate big data / complex data sets clearly.
You’ve applied agile software development methodologies and tools before
You create energy and clarity. You have great communication skills that help you bring people together behind a common goal, manage multiple points of view and create clarity and organisation into complex problems and diverse teams.
You enjoy getting deep into the processing logic. You like to be thorough and understand how things work and all their dependencies in-depth. You don’t mind working in the non-customer facing team and bringing clarity to the team over complicated processes, while independently make sense of complex topics and break them down into smaller, more manageable pieces.

 Beneficial, but not mandatory experience

Finance / accounting background
Experience working with business analytics tools (e.g. Looker, Superset)
Passion for technical products and understanding of tech stacks used in software engineering


Our Offer

Base salary:  €32,400 - €58,800 gross / year base (based on experience & interview outcomes)
Restricted Stock Units (RSUs): https://www.wise.jobs/what-we-do/our-offer/ 
 Numerous amount of other benefits: 
https://www.wise.jobs/2020/07/02/benefits-in-our-tallinn-office

Salary (annual)€32.400—€58.800 EURWe're people without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive. We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.
Every Wiser should feel that they can be themselves at work. Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to share their contributions towards mission zero and able to progress in their careers.
Having diverse teams that reflect our diverse customer base helps us build a better product. We can be more creative and empathetic to our customer's needs and life experiences and makes sure we leave no-one behind on our journey to mission-zero.
If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.
Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

demographic_questions.header: Wise Diversity and Inclusion - Voluntary Demographic Questions
demographic_questions.description:
The following voluntary questions are intended to help us learn about the various identities and backgrounds that make up the candidates applying to Wise. If you don't feel comfortable answering you can select I don't wish to answer.

Providing us with this information will help us take actions that support underrepresented groups and make sure our hiring process is inclusive and fair for everyone.

The questions may be sensitive to some, please know your survey responses are secure and optional. All data will be handled anonymously, aggregated and not linked to you.There will be no adverse consequences if you do not wish to complete this questionnaire, or if you partially complete it or you select ‘prefer not to say’ to any question. It will in no way impact your opportunity to work for us within the application or hiring process.

Our privacy policy explains how we collect and process your data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you have any questions, please email hiring-privacy@wise.com.

questions.label: What gender identity do you most closely identify with?
I identify my race/ethnicity as (mark all that apply):

answer_options.label: Black or of African or Caribbean descent

questions.label: Do you live with a disability? (Disability covers mental and physical health impairments or conditions, including things like anxiety, visual or hearing impairments, long-term health conditions)
Why would you like to join Wise?
Please briefly describe a product you worked on recently which involved integrating with 3rd parties, something you're especially proud of
Are you currently eligible to work in Estonia?
Please give an indication as to your desired base salary.
